sentence: Unilever PLC ( UL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on April 27, 2016.
A cash dividend payment of $0.3648 per share Shareholders who purchased UL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 10.68% increase over the prior quarter.
At the current stock price of $46.21, the dividend yield is 3.16%.
The previous trading day's last sale of UL was $46.21, representing a -3.53% decrease from the 52 week high of $47.90 and a 19.72% increase over the 52 week low of $38.60.
UL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
Zacks Investment Research reports UL's forecasted earnings growth in 2016 as 6.93%, compared to an industry average of 3.9%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the UL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
